name: The Ritz-Carlton, South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: The Ritz in South Beach is everything you'd expect from a Ritz. It's very classy with great service. The location is great - it's right on the beach. Our room was clean, large and had a large bathroom. The pool is wonderful (the hot tub wasn't working during our visit) and the pool area has many amenities - including a "Tanning Butler" and a host to cover your chair with a towel and serve you overpriced food and drink. The spa at the Ritz is more expensive than other spas - cheapest massage was around $150 BUT you can use the spa area even if you don't book a treatment. So you can enjoy the sauna, steam-room and lounge for free & at any time. The nightlife nearby is easily accessible - don't expect the Ritz to draw any crowds so it's quiet at your hotel and you can party elsewhere. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Exactly what you'd hope for from a Ritz-Carlton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I knew coming to South Beach (SoBe) that this Ritz-Carlton would be unlike any others in regards to atmosphere. Indeed it was! I appreciated every moment of it.
reviews.title: A Jazzed Up Ritz-Carlton Experience in SoBe

likes.liked: — Concierge lounge staff service. Front desk efficiency. Pool scene. Weather.
likes.disliked: — No direct elevator for wing rooms. Use of two sepearte elevators required.

reviews.title: Everything you'd expect from the Ritz-Carlton
reviews.text: If you’ve never been to South Beach, be advised that it is young and hip from my experience. I noticed that some elderly couples were checking in seemingly in shock and awe at the upbeat club-style music pumping in the lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived via a cab directly from the Miami International Airport (@ $30 one way) and was promptly greeted and attended to. My bags were rolling before I could even step foot on the ground. Excellent service!
reviews.title: Very Good Experience

likes.liked: — Ritz Carlton met the challenge of the SoBe environment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I arrived early and my request for an early check-in was promptly met (at 10 a.m.!). Front desk agent MATTHEW was superb, personal, and very quick in assisting me and answering any questions (I always have lots of them). The other front desk agent even offered a chilled bottle of water while I waited for him to make a photo copy in the back office.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Where do I begin. The hotel has done a great job of updating Lapidus design making it modern but keeping the original feel. There are staff everywhere making sure that everything you need is done. Each person finished my interaction by asking "what else can I do for you'? The staff is well hired and trained. The bed was so comfortable I never wanted to get out. I had a room on the club level, where the service and food presentations were outstanding. I was welcomed each time, asked what I had done with my day and they seemed genuinely interested in my having the best time possible, not just doing their job. I have never stayed in any hotel where so many of the staff remembered my name. Do yourself a favor and eat at Evolution by David Bouley, an amazing dining experience in a gorgeous space. Pool area is great and again, staff goes out of their way to accommodate. I am already looking at dates for my next visit. Be ware that the local area can be rough. If you are going more than a few blocks, take a taxi.
reviews.title: Superb property and service

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping could have been a bit more attentive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here the night before my husband and me left from Miami International Airport for our honeymoon. We had an amazing time. The staff was incredibly friendly and always willing to help. We had mentioned in passing to the front desk agent that we had just gotten married. An hour later, we heard a knock on our door - it was room service bringing us complimentary chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne. Now that is 5-star service!
reviews.title: A Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Awesome! A great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated our ten year anniversary at the Ritz SoBe, July 26 – 29, 2007. When we arrived, the hotel seemed busy but we were quickly greeted by the bellmen and although we didn't need help with our carryon size luggage, they took them from our hands, gave me a claim ticket for my car and asked us to check in. The lobby is very modern, clean and very welcoming with its refrigerator like air conditioning. The staff at the Ritz Carlton are friendly and very willing to help. We were given an unexpected upgrade to the club level and within no time we were in our room, changing into our bathing suits to head out to the beach. While changing to our bathing suits, we got a knock on the door by room service who brought us chocolate covered strawberries, wishing us happy anniversary. The rooms are very modern and clean and the bathrooms are large. Bathrooms had all the toiletries including toothbrush and toothpaste. Our room was ocean view on the 9th floor which was overlooking the pool with a balcony, overseeing the ocean skyline. Besides for the occasional loud speaking guest that walk the hallways, the room was very quiet and noise proof. Even the blowers on the air conditioning units are quite.

I am thankful that I stayed at the property in Cancun first (which was fantastic.) If I would have stayed at RC Miami first, I would have cancelled my stay in Cancun and missed out on what a real Ritz Carlton is like.

reviews.text: The lobby of the hotel is the only thing impressive. Every floor and every hall look the exact same. The wall paper is coming up and the carpet is frayed. The company will COMP almost anything so make sure you complain if you have a problem. They over book the hotel all the time and over price things you could get for yourself. Half the staff actually put an effort into making people happy the other half are just there for a paycheck. Trust me just because it says Ritz-Carlton doesn't mean its nice.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: I have been to this property a number of times over the years since it opened. The first few years it was a wonderful hotel/resort with top notch service, great food and superb rooms. I'm am sorry to report that it's just not Ritz quality any longer. I'll keep this brief: The reception personnel were below average. However, the front desk manager was fine. The restaurant service was almost as good as a fast food establishment. Further, the buffet breakfast in the morning was terrible. Poor selection of food, not fresh, and often slow to be replaced when empty. Unfortunately, it's time for a big overhaul at this location. The rooms are really tired (we had a large suite) with pillow stained and carpet worn. For the money, there are many, many other other places in Sobe that are wonderful.

reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton as part of our honey moon. All the staff are fantastic especially all the conceirges who were most helpfull. We changed our room on arrival as we were not happy with it. This was painless. The Location of this hotel is spot on, everything you need is around you. The pool area is clean and tidy, the staff are helpfull. Although the cocktails are seriously over priced and not very good. The bar area is lovely and the breakfasts are to die for!!! The rooms are not huge, and there are no modern appliances that you find in some hotels. I would stay here again but we visited quite few hotels on South Beach and there are lots to choose from so maybe we would try something different. I would reccomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have always been a great fan of the Ritz and have stayed in a few of their hotels world wide I have also stayed at the Ritz South Beach in the summer of '06 and my experience then was great. Unfortunately I can’t say the same about our last trip in August of ’07,, The hotel seemed to be fully occupied which may have contributed to the problem, in any case a hotel of this standard should be able to deal with that or not take as many bookings. Upon check in at 4pm our rooms were not ready as the guests had not checked out yet (and the receptionist rudely said “what do u want me to do, I can’t find the guests!”. So after much debate we were given a temporary room so we could feed and change the kids (2,4) unfortunately our bags were never brought up to the room so that was a pointless exercise. One of our rooms was ready at 5.30pm and the other at 6.30pm! The next day I was not impressed with housekeeping who didn’t come to clean the rooms until 3pm, so after a day at the beach forget walking into a clean room with fresh towels. Room service was just as unimpressive with our breakfast sitting in the hotel hallway till after 4pm! We had booked ocean view rooms, but they should be called “partial ocean view” because there is a low rise building blocking the right of the “ocean view”. To top it all of we had prepaid this trip with our travel agent and unfortunately the Ritz charged our card for the entire stay, we are still trying to sort that out! Would I stay at the Ritz South Beach again.. I probably would give it one more try, just to give them the benefit of the doubt as this may have been a one off.
reviews.title: Dissapointed with the Ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz from August 20 - 23. I am single parent travelling with one child. We booked at the conference rate as I was in town on business. Didn't realize until too late that the room block called for rooms with no view and no balcony. By the time I noticed it in the paperwork, it was too late. All other rooms were sold out. At check-in, I asked to be wait listed for a better room, but no opportunity availed. Should've known the $179 rate per night was too good to be true. We were arriving at the Ritz from the Wynn in Vegas and so, the bar had been set for us. Neverthess, our room was a bit cramped - one king, writing desk tucked in the only open corner and so close to the wall that the sheet rock was peeling and cracking on the floor from the number of times the desk chair had rubbed the wall. Window views were to the rooftop with no visibility to the streets or the ocean. Electrical outlets incredibly spare. Luckily, my child was small and agile enough to have crawled under the desk to the wall behind it and plug in our laptop. Couldn't figure out the alarm clock operation despite the notes on the night stand. Never found a phone book in the room or any information about dining or shopping in the immediate area. Instead, there were magazines about the history of the property, a model-esque publication touting expensive outfits and swimwear. Food prices were high, in my opinion, except for the kid's meals. One kudos to the Ritz South Beach...the Ritz Kids program was a huge help and convenience. My only suggestion regarding the program would be to offer an evening option upon request that might be less expensive that the referrals to outside groups. We were referred to Nanny Poppinz (spelled with a "z"; otherwise you ge the Boston branch) and, although they were extremely accomodating and able to locate a nanny for us, use of the two services together - Ritz Kids Camp from 9-4 and Nanny Poppinz from 4-8 - cost right at $240 a day and still caused me to miss 8am meetings and the 9am shuttle. I still would recommend both services highly to anyone not bothered by the expense. We'll be better prepared next time. One other note about the Camp...my daughter spilled something on her pants soon after arriving there for the day. Our baggage was lost in transition by the airline and so she didn't have a change of clothes. Not only did the camp counselors have her clothes dry cleaned, but they also went to Macy's and bought her a new outfit. I was floored. This is obviously above and beyond anything that I would have expected. As you other parents know, kid's spill things and ruin clothes daily and, well, we salvage what we can and call the rest "play clothes". A huge THANK YOU to the hotel for going so far above and beyond!
reviews.title: The right room makes the difference

likes.liked: — Rtiz Kids Camp, Quality service from front desk and housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: Back to the hotel, the building is older so you can hear creeking from walkers overhead and in the hallway. Despite heavy doors, noise from someone running the hallway awoke me one night. Another night, the laughing and talking from the room next door, didn't stop until I finally gave in and called Guest Services/Security at 3:14am. They were prompt in handling the issue and I was back asleep. The a/c operates well above a whisper, so if you're used to TV or radio to fall asleep, you'll be adjusting the volume each time the a/c unit comes on and again when it goes off. The in-room coffee maker - 1 cup at a time - featured a nice coffee and was easy to use and quick to make. The mini bar was well stocked, but we skipped the expense and bought water and sundries from the Walgreens immediately across the street. Walgreens also had deli sandwiches, fresh fruits and Krispy Kreme doughnuts! I heard that Barton G's is a popular place to eat, but being busy, we never made it. Housekeeping was very attentive, but be forewarned that they don't start until late in the day. If you leave early and arrive back before lunch time, your room will be the same way you left it. So, if you drink all of the coffee first thing in the morning, it'll be evening before you get some fresh water and coffee packets. Ritz has BVLGARI brand soap, shampoo, etc. which is very nice. I think most folks who care about name-brand perfumed toiletries usually bring their own (at least we do). I'd prefer that the Ritz offer their own momogramed slippers to wear on those cold marble restroom floors or else provide a 3-prong extension cord to make up for limited outlets or else put a telephone directory and/or reference page of nearby eating and shopping in each room. The front desk staff was cordial and helpful - both directly and when I called from the room. Loved how they stepped from behind the counter when handing over the room key in order to point us in the right direction. Certainly not a necessary action, but an impressive one nonetheless. Unfortunately, I wasn't as impressed with concierge. One of the reps at the concierge desk was always engrossed in private conversation when we arrived and the conversation didn't end just because a waiting client was standing there. Both times, we eventually gave up and walked away. I both loved and resented the need to present a room key at the elevator to get upstairs. What a wonderful, added measure of security - when you can scrounge around your purse and get to the room key easily. What an inconvenience when you can't :)
reviews.title: Great Location and Pool...

A very small window with a partial pool view. I wouldn't waste the money unless you really want the extra half bathroom.

reviews.text: The location is perfect right on the beach with direct access to the lovely beach promenade for walking and jogging and a short less than 5 minute walk to Lincoln Road Mall (which is actually a tree line pedestrianised street) full of shops and decent middle of road restaurants, some with open air dining. The best restaurants in my opinion are at the bottom of Ocean Drive - Joes Stone Crab, Prime 112, Nemo etc. You could walk to these in about 20/30 mins we got cabs at $10 each way , worth it!
reviews.title: good choice for us
Not quite a true "Ritz" experience.
reviews.text: There has been talk of the expensive Buffet breakfast at $26 full , including champagne,and $19 continental (no hot food or champagne) . We tried eating breakfast out at the nearby Jerrys Diner. We paid less, not that much less, but the quality was nowhere near as good and it was a 10 minute walk away. So we settled for the delicious continental buffet .Jerrys however, is worth a visit just for the experience. I suggest people go and way the buffet up and I am sure you will see how fresh and varied it is. Not a grand buffet by American standards but it has everything you might want and all is perfectly formed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Probably the best on south beach

The pool area is not that large and did fill up at the weekend and became quite raucus at times but with a vast beach on the doorstep it is not a big problem.
reviews.title: One of the best in the area

They upgraded our room because ours was not ready yet and we were able to check in at 11 AM. You seriously do not need to lift a finger here. The staff is so friendly, outgoing and helpful. I dont see myself staying anywhere else again in South Beach.

Pedestrian Palace
reviews.text: - This hotel is extremely child-friendly, which may not be a positive point if you are not traveling with children. However, if you’re looking for a place where the entire family will feel welcome, you will definitely find that here. There is plenty of room for strollers in the restaurants, and there are ramps in all the public areas: lobby, mezzanine, and from the hotel to the beach. Employees were very friendly to our children, engaged them in conversation, and let us know what activities were available for kids.

reviews.title: great hotel..very impressive lobby and common areas....
reviews.text: Arrival at the hotel was great....ended up driving to Miami Beach from Orlando to spend the night. Was greeted by the Valet parking and practically whisked the room after a brief stop at check-in...no fuss really.

reviews.title: Great location, rest is OK
reviews.text: Had a Pool view lanai suite - rather expensive for what it was...so not sure it was a great value, but it was still a nice room. Location of the hotel was superb...could walk in either direction to the restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. As it was our first time in Miami we did a lot of exploring to see what was around.

reviews.title: The Ritz-Carlton South Beach went above and beyond with service and room accomodations
reviews.text: The concierge and doormen were great - offering lots of advice on where to go and greeting us on our return.

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!!!
reviews.text: I did want to grab a drink in their "bar"...which is really just a collection of tables and chairs in a what would be otherwise empty space near the elevators. No one appeared to be around however to take drink orders. The breakfast the next morning at the buffet was very overpriced for what it was (not that I was surprised), and the service was mediocre. Check-out was great - brought the car around and moved all the other cars out of the way as it was raining so we did not get wet. They were nice enough to remove empty water bottles and replenish us with new ones for the drive back to Orlando.

reviews.title: Stunning Location, Breath-taking Prices
reviews.text: The hotel has some good advantages. Foremost its location is great. Directly at the beach and at the end of Lincoln Road you just walk out of the hotel and are in the heart of South Beach. The hotel was built around 7 years ago so the rooms are nicer than most expensive overpriced renovated hotels. The service is not very personal, but ok. Being right on the beach with the possibility to order drinks and food on the beach is great. The breakfast buffet is rich and also the setting quite nice. I would recommend the hotel if you like the beach and are there for leisure.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Ritz South Beach. - both for business for a few days. The location is great but of course since I was travelling on business my exposure to Miami or the Beach were limtied. The hotel is just a short walk (5 min or less) to LIncoln Road - a great place with shops, restaurants. The hotel is right on the beach - direct access from the hotel just cross a walk path which is maybe 2 yards wide- really nice and convenient. The pool and jacuzzi looked great> Everyone very friendly. The housekeeping was a bit slow but overall I did get things done when I wanted it. Can't really complain. I would go back on a personal trip or back on business in a heart beat!

reviews.title: Great stay!
reviews.text: I stayed at the South Beach Ritz Carlton from May 24 to May 25. It was only 1 night but my experience was wonderful. Every member of the staff was extremely helpful and courteous and I don't think I could have asked for better service. The concierge was also amazing, helping my girlfriends and I cancel one restaurant reservation and making another for us. Also, I found the room clean and very comfortable and the bathroom was immaculate. The pool was wonderful and you can walk right to the beach from there. I will definitely stay here next time I am in South Beach.

reviews.title: Treated us like V.I.P
reviews.text: The best hospitality anyone could ask for. We had a few blips with our room, but we were compensated 10 fold. The staff in every department were very professional and made us feel so comfortable. The pool area and beach are beautiful. we would like to thank the entire staff ( you know who you are) from the front desk, restaurant staff who made our special dinner night wonderful, pool staff who were so friendly and fun conversations to the management who helped us out. We will definetly be back again. Thank you so much.

reviews.title: OUTSTANDING

The furniture looked (and felt) like it had been been rehabbed & transferred over from their Ritz Kansas City property (no disrespect meant for KC). What a joke. Here we were, in the heart of the trendy, designy South Beach, and I have royal blue striped conference room chairs in my room, with a horrible Ethan Allen breakfront that stores my TV that is not watchable from my bed! BTW, the TV was really old and had the kind of bad static-y speakers that you find on old reconditioned TVs.
reviews.title: Worst Service at a Ritz Carlton EVER

reviews.title: High's and Low's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Food was mediocre and honestly, at this price point, I know that there are other options... for food and lodging, with much more glamorous rooms, better food, and less nickel and diming on site
reviews.title: loved it
Absolutely fabulous!
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. The hotel is lovely, not too big and all the staff get to know you by name. The location cannont be beaten- right in the heart of South Beach with the ocean on your doorstep. The Lincoln Road shops are just moments away. The pool is gorgeous and the service impecable. The spa and fitness centre are brilliant. I highly recommend this fabulous hotel!

reviews.title: A good choice in the perfect location
reviews.text: Besides the overall quality and remarkable service that Ritz Carlton usually provides, this hotel has two major advantages: perfect location and direct access to the beach. I can't imagine a stay in Miami without a car, but if you hate to drive, this is the spot to stay, and you don't have many hotels to pick from at this category level (Loews, Delano, Gansevoort, W). The RC is spotless and we very much enjoyed its large pool and beach service which includes 4 chairs per room if you need that many. In every sense the hotel is spotless. Our standard room was fine and very comfortable with an ample and well design bathroom. It overlook the city and we were gratefully surprised with how soundproof it was, no noise at all coming from the street. The RC is very quiet so if you expect some of the night activity that South Beach offers in your own hotel, look elsewhere. I would try the W or the Gansevoort next time which are in the same price range. Parking is $38 plus tips so I recommend take your car one block to James st. where is a lot that will cost you $25. Internet is $9.95 per day, looks affordable but know that Miami Beach City offers free wifi (not high speed) so you can hook up to it at no cost.

reviews.title: Great Place for a meeting
reviews.text: I just attended our company's Global Meeting and all I can say is these guys know how to service a meeting. Interesting venues for meals and fun and also a great staff that allows you to conduct a good meeting. All I can say is that I was impressed and my hats off to the staff and leadership of The Ritz-Carlton, South Beach. I'm looking forward to bringing my family back when so they can experience the leisure side of the resort.

reviews.title: The Best Customer Service I Have Ever Experienced
reviews.text: Impressed and unforgettable are the two words that come to mind when I think about my recent stay at the Ritz-Carlton, South Beach. I was traveling with my mom to celebrate her birthday and the hotel did everything in their power to ensure we had a memorable stay. The staff at this hotel was unbelievable and would honor every request we had with a smile and promptness.

reviews.title: Never worth the money in a million years, Dont let the brochure fool youl!!!!
reviews.text: The pool area was lovely and the lounge chairs were incredibly comfortable. Ideal location too! Within walking distance to all shops and restaurants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayted at the Ritz Carlton South Beach for two nights after a weeks stay in the Bahamas. Although it was pricey, $339.00 per night, I booked it because I had never stayed at a Ritz property.
reviews.title: The Ritz is the best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon checking in we were informed that we had been upgraded to their Club Level. At the Club reception area they have five food and drink presentations per day. What a plus!!! The staff was very friendly and efficent. The room we had was spacious and had a wonderful view of the pool and the ocean. Ther was a small balcony that had two chairs and a talbe.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Ritz - Good Service, Great Food, Tech Friendly

likes.liked: — Great service, classic, great food, internet availability, room size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We did not have much time to enjoy all this hotel had to offer. I had comtemplated getting a massage - $140.00 for 50 minutes plus a 20% service charge, but decided to spend my money on other activities. We did enjoy the pool on two occasions, Saturday afternoon when it was very crowded, and Monday morning before we had to check out when it was virtually ours alone.
reviews.title: will never stay any other place but here....

likes.disliked: — THAT WE HAD TO GO HOME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The valet for our rental car cost $30.00 per night but being from San Francisco and staying downtown at least once a yrear, at a cost of $40.00 to $50.00 per night to park our car, I did not feel that this was out of line. On one ocaasion it took awhile to get our vehicle but the othrer two times our car came right away. The valets brought us bottles of chilled water to take with us on our journeys.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.disliked: — The front reception was too dark and the business centre shut at 4pm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat at the hotel except for the Club level which was fantastic. For breakfast bagels with all the fixings, breads, pastries, cereals, and fruits were offered. We went for the 3:00 tea service which offered scones and finger sandwiches. For the cocktail hour 5:30 - 7:30PM many different appetizers were offered as well as wines and soft drinks. Their was always a concierge on duty to help with any plans or to answer questions. The Club Level was the best!!!
reviews.title: Great Location and Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was decent, but there was construction going on (we are talking jackammers on cement at the bar by the pool), which was terribly annoying and made it hard to enjoy the pool. We should have been alerted about the construction in advance. In April, it was filled with drunken spring break types, which was not at all what I expected from a Ritz, and that also made it hard to enjoy the pool. So the next day we went to the beach just to listen to annoying people talking loudly on their cell phones the entire time. On the upside, the room and bathroom was very nice.
reviews.title: Horrible - was filled with drunken spring breakers

likes.disliked: — kind of people staying there, construction going on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We should have stayed at the Ritz in Coconut Grove, which I heard is wonderful.
reviews.title: Great for chilling out
Not quite up to Ritz Standards
reviews.text: We chose to stay at the Ritz Carlton because of its reputation and we were not disappointed. This was much need r &r after an exhausting trip to South America, and provided just the chill out time we needed before flying back to the UK. I booked online early in 2007 and checking the rates shortly before we left discovered there was a better deal. It was no problem changing to the new cheaper package. The room was fabulous with a very nice bath and walk in shower, although the vanity unit was a bit tacky. Also the toileteries were not quite up to RC standard although branded 'Bulgari' - they were just the regular small bottles of shower gel, shampoo etc and weren't replenished. A nice touch was the tea coffee maker in the room, although again this was not fully replenished each day and it proved hard to get some replacement tea bags when I went to the front desk as I didn't want to be disturbed in the room by housekeeping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a beauttifully restored architectural classic: Morris Lapidus' 50's De Lilo hotel. The public areas are sleek and modern and the atmosphere is buzzy. I was worried that the pool area would be too crowded to find places but there were plenty of loungers and the staff were really helpful. We arrived on a Sunday so there was plenty of action including live music (two lots of competing bands) around the pool. Some renovations were going on in the pool area to the restaurant but it did not impinge on our enjoyment.
reviews.title: Ritz Carlton is Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is unique in South Beach as it is the only one with an ocean view and it was wonderful to watch the activity on the boardwalk and look out to sea. Although the beach is not private the RC has an area with its own service, loungers etc. which is well laid out.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It took me a while to type this up because this really is one of my favorite hotel brands but I hope the constructive criticism is helpful.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me say first that this is a fabulous location. You are close enough to everything you’d want to get to (including Lincoln Rd shopping) but not right on Ocean and its busyness. The hotel itself is very beautiful. It’s chic and quite SOBE-esqe. And the views of the ocean are amazing. The pool scene is great! I normally am way too hyper to be able to sit still for 15 minutes but we didn’t leave the pool for days. We enjoyed mimosa’s every morning (T.Y. Reconnect Package) and a fabulous buffet spread for breakfast. The poolside frozen mojito’s were delicious. I also really liked my lunch at DiLido Beach Club.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was SO excited to come to this hotel. I’d kept my eye on the property for over two years before it opened and waited patiently through various delays and set backs. Then I got so busy that I wasn’t able to visit and every time I tried to make a reservation they were “fully committed”. So imagine my delight to find availability for the 4th of July weekend at a very wonderful rate that included parking (say hallelujah, this is South Beach) and daily buffet breakfast. I wanted to pinch myself. I picked up the phone and called the girlfriend most likely to join me at the very last minute (translation: spoiled and self indulgent enough as we bought our tickets and booked the package the day before we left). In less than 36 hours from ticket and hotel reservations we were raiding the mini-bar for cocktail fixing’s.
reviews.title: Great Labor Day getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And less than 24 hours after our arrival I was so disillusioned and so rightly indignant and upset that I’d gotten the okay from management to be released from my reservation early and was ready to check out and go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Wonderful experience
reviews.text: Service? This hotel has some serious service and consistency issues. We decided to relax by the pool Sunday morning and were basically ignored. There were about 6 or 7 guests at the pool and about 5 pool staff. Only one woman got any attention, including having her umbrella opened for her over her pool chair when it began to rain. We looked about expectantly but couldn’t get anyone’s attention. After sitting there in surprise for a few minutes we ran for dry land.

aka: Ritz-Carlton South Beach Hotel Miami Beach
